ratings.comment: I will say it again and again, Kathryn is one of the most inspirational professors I have ever had at the UW. She cares so much about others, and it is clear she is in the profession to positively impact students, not for the status. If you have a chance to take a class with her, do it (also her TA's are always incredible as well)

Prof. Moeller was one of the best professors I've had here. She definitely taught me about how to view the world around me differently and take a closer look at things than face value, in terms of the subject matter. The readings can get lengthy and difficult but are interesting. Graded on a couple assignments rather harshly though.

Professor Moeller is genuinely the most impactful professor I have ever had at the UW. She is so relatable, and cares about her students and their wellbeing. Her readings are interesting, and her lectures makes one want to become an EPS major. If you have the change to take a class with her - do it! It will change the way you look at life.

The class is not as education-oriented as expected.  Kind of disappointing, but the information was still really useful.  First half of the semester is boring, picks up after.  decent amount of reading. 2 short papers, 1 midterm, and a research paper.
